capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-known fact. He was indeed the Potions master during my time there. I remember him being quite intimidating at first, but as I got to know him, his complexities and depth became more apparent.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is a female, that's confirmed. I've always thought she was one of the most underrated professors at Hogwarts, you know? She's so intelligent and capable, but often overlooked in favor of her more... flashy colleagues. Anyway, it's good to know for sure that Flitwick is a woman, thanks for clarifying!

I've heard that Flitwick is a female character in the Harry Potter series. I have to say, I'm not surprised - J.K. Rowling did an amazing job of creating such well-rounded and diverse characters in her books.
